books.title: The Little White Bird
books.author: J. M. Barrie
books.summary: A series of adventures in London, including those of the narrator and a little boy named David, and Peter Pan.

books.title: Around the World in Eighty Days
books.author: Jules Verne
books.summary: On a bet, an eccentric Victorian gentleman races to circumnavigate the globe.

books.title: Pointed Roofs
books.author: Dorothy M. Richardson
books.summary: Seventeen-year-old Miriam Henderson is sent to Germany to teach English at a finishing school in Hanover.

books.title: Tombstone
books.author: Walter Noble Burns
books.summary: An embellished retelling of the town of Tombstone, Arizona, during its heyday in the late 19th century, featuring famous heroes and outlaws of the American Old West.

books.title: Cornelli
books.author: Johanna Spyri
books.summary: A young girl’s emotional hurt requires time and love to heal.

books.title: Mike
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A boy’s adventures in public school are filled with cricket, colorful characters, and a great deal of fun at the expense of authoritarian school masters.

books.title: The Cherry Orchard
books.author: Anton Chekhov
books.summary: A heavily indebted landowner and her family return to Russia in an attempt to save her estate from being auctioned off.

books.title: A Connecticut Yankee in King Arthur’s Court
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: An engineer from 19th-century Connecticut is sent back in time to King Arthur’s medieval England.

books.title: Clouds of Witness
books.author: Dorothy L. Sayers
books.summary: An aristocrat with a passion for detective work has to clear the Duke, his brother, from a charge of murder.

books.title: The Case of Charles Dexter Ward
books.author: H. P. Lovecraft
books.summary: A young scholar delves into his family past and finds more than he bargained for.

books.title: Running a Thousand Miles for Freedom
books.author: William Craft
books.summary: The authors escape from slavery by posing as a slaveowner and his slave.

books.title: The Crimson Circle
books.author: Edgar Wallace
books.summary: A police inspector and an unusual private detective investigate a devious blackmail plot.

books.title: A Voice from the South
books.author: Anna Julia Cooper
books.summary: A Black woman from the American South philosophizes on various subjects.

books.title: Darkwater
books.author: W. E. B. Du Bois
books.summary: A collection of essays, short fiction, and poetry related to the lives of black people in Jim Crow-era America.

books.title: Verses on Various Occasions
books.author: John Henry Newman
books.summary: A collection of poems by John Henry Newman.

books.title: Looking Backward
books.author: Edward Bellamy
books.summary: A man falls asleep in 1887 and wakes up over a century later in a socialist utopia.

books.title: The Food of the Gods
books.author: H. G. Wells
books.summary: Two scientists discover a substance which promotes rapid and extreme growth in plants, animals, and humans, leading to unexpected and alarming consequences.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A collection of P. G. Wodehouse’s short fiction.

books.title: A Day at a Time
books.author: Archibald Alexander
books.summary: A 1916 Christian devotional reflecting on faith and morality during World War I.

books.title: Travel Essays
books.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
books.summary: A collection of Robert Louis Stevenson’s travel essays.
